content.description:
Fun climb with great position. For a single-pitch rock climb, this one allows you to feel nicely exposed. You've already hiked a couple hundred feet from the canyon floor, so halfway up this route, you're soaring. A great opportunity for a moderate climber to get high in the sky.

No real crux, just fun, steep and sustained face climbing on the right side of the arete.

Just for fun, an anecdote: My first time climbing this route, I was belaying my climbing partner, and the golden eagle that used to inhabit the canyon (I haven't seen it in nearly two years, sadly), came swooping around the arete, just above my partner's head. Impressive and intimidating!
content.location: Right  of Hollowed Ground (11.a), which I've not climbed.

content.description: The crux of the route is at the beginning getting up to the first bolt. it starts to ease up after the second bolt and then merges with Pocket Full of Corprolite at the sixth bolt. Rock quality up to the first bolt isn't that great so be careful.
content.location: About 15 feet left of Pocket Full of Corprolite.
